gurmukhi: dYNqn sMGwrnI piqq lok qwrnI su sMkt invwrnI ik AYsI qUM Skq hY ]bydn auDwrnI suryNdR rwj kwrnI pY gaurjw kI jwgY joiq Aaur jwq kq hY ]
transliteration: Daintan Sanhaaranipatit Lok Taaranisu Sankat Nivaaraniki Aisitoon Shakt Hai|| Bedan Udhaaranisurendra Jaaj Kaaranipai Gadddajaa Kijaagad Jot(i) Aur Jaat Kat Hai||
translation: “O goddess! Thou art the power, who destroys the demons, ferries across the sinners from this world and removes the sufferings, thou are the redeemer of the Vedas, Giver of the kingdom to Indra the shining light of Gauri;

gurmukhi: DUA mY n Drw mY n iDAwn DwrI mY pY kCU jYsy qyry joiq bIc Awn nw Ckq hY ]idns idnyS mY idvwn mY suryS mY supq mY mhyS joiq qyrI AY jgiq hY ]245]
transliteration: Dhooa Mai Na Dharaa Mai Na Dhiaan Dhaarimai Pai Kachhodh Jaise Dere Jot(i) Beech Aan Naa Chhakat Hai|| Dinas Dinesh Mai Divaan Mai Suresh Mai Soupat Mai Mahesh Jot(i) Teriai Jagad(i) Hai||245||
translation: “There is no other light like Thee on the earth and in the sky; Thou art in the sun, moon, stars, Indra and Shiva etc. glowing as light in all.”245.

gurmukhi: ibnqI krq sB gopI kir joir joir suin lyhu ibnqI hmwrI ieh cMifkw ]sur qY aubwry koit piqq auDwry cMf muMf muMf fwry muMB insuMB kI KMifkw ]
transliteration: Bintikarat Sabh Gopi Kar(i) Jor(i) Jor(i) Soun(i) Leh(u) Binti Hamaari Eh Channddika || Surr Te Oubade Kotee Patit Uddare Mounnd Mounnd Ddare Sounbh Nisounbh Ki Khanndikaa||
translation: All the gopis are praying with folded hands, “O Chandi! Listen to our prayer, because you have redeemed also the gods, ferried across millions of sinners and destroyed Chand, Mund, Sumbh and Nisumbh;

gurmukhi: dIjY mwgXo dwn hÍY pRq`C khY myrI mweI pUjy hm qumY nwhI pUjy suq gMfkw ]hÍY kir pRsMnX qwko khXo SIGR mwn dIno vhY brdwn Puin rwinn kI mMifkw ]246]
transliteration: Deejai Maagyo Daan Hvai Pratachchh Kahai Merimaaipooje Ham Toumai Naahipooje Sout Gadndkaa|| Hvai Kar(i) Prasannya Taako Kahyo Sheeghra Maan Deeno Vahai Bardaan Phoun(i) Raanin Kimanndikaa||246||
translation: “O mother! Bestow on us the boon asked for; we are worshipping you and Shaligram, the son of Gandak river, because you had been pleased to accept his saying; therefore bestow on us the boon.”246.
Speech of the goddess addressed to the gopis:

gurmukhi: hÍY Brqw Ab so qumro hir dwn iehY durgw iqn dInw ]so Duin sRaunn mY sun kY iqn koit pRnwm qbY auT kInw ]
transliteration: Hvai Bhartaa Ab So Toumro Har(i) Daan Ihai Durgad Tin Deenaa|| So Dhoun(i) Sraounan Mai Soun Kai Tin Kottee Pranaam Tabai Outh Keedaa||
translation: “Your husband will be Krishna.” Saying thus, Durga bestowed boon on them; hearing these words, all of them got up and bowed before the goddess millions of times;

gurmukhi: qw Cib ko js au`c mhw kib ny Apny mn mY Puin cInw ]hY ienko mnu kwnHr mY Aau ju pY rs kwnHr ky sMig BInw ]247]
transliteration: Taa Chhab(i) Ko Jas Ouchch Mahaa Kabi Ne Apne Man Mai Phoun(i) Cheenaa|| Hai Inko Man(u) Kaahnar Mai Au Ju Pai Ras Kaahnar Ke San(i) Bheenaa||247||
translation: The poet has considered in his mind this spectacle in this way that they all have been dyed in the love of Krishna and absorbed in him.247.

gurmukhi: pwie prI iqh ky qb hI sB BwNq krI bhu qwih bfweI ]hY jg ky krqw hrqw duK hY sB qUM gx gMDRb mweI ]
transliteration: Paae Paritih Ke Tab Hisabh Bhaant Karibahu Taah(i) Badaaee|| Hai Jag Kikartaa Hartaa Doukh Hai Sabh Toon Gad Gaddhrab Maaee||
translation: All the gopis falling at the feet of the goddess began to eulogise her in various ways; “O the mother of the world! You are the remover of the suffering of all the world, you are the mother of ganas and gandharvas,”

gurmukhi: qw Cib kI Aiq hI aupmw kib ny muK qy iem BwK sunweI ]lwl BeI qb hI gupIAw Puin bwq jbY mn bwCq pweI ]248]
transliteration: Taa Chhah(i) Kiat(i) Hioupmaa Kabi Ne Moukh Te Im Bhaakh Sounaaee|| Laal Bhaitab Higoupeeaa Phoun(i) Baat Jabai Man Baachhat Paaee||248||
translation: The poet says that on realizing Krishna as their husband, the faces of all the gopis were filled with happiness and shyness and became red.248.

gurmukhi: lY brdwn sBY gupIAw Aiq AwnMd kY mn fyrn AweI ]gwvq gIq sBY iml kY iek hÍYkY pRsMnX su dyq bDweI ]
transliteration: Lai Bardaan Sabhai Goupeeaa At(i) Aanand Kai Man Deran Aaee|| Gadvat Geet Sabhai Mil Kai Ik Hvai-kai Prasannya Su Det Badhaaee||
translation: The gopis returned to their homes, being pleased, on receiving the desired boon and began to congratulate one another and exhibited their joy by singing songs;

gurmukhi: pwNqn swQ KrI iqnkI aupmw kib ny muK qy iem gweI ]mwnhu pwie inswpiq ko sr m`iD iKrI kvIAw Dur qweI ]249]
transliteration: Paantan Saath Kharitinkioupmaa Kabi Ne Moukh Te Im Gadee|| Maanoh Paae Nisaapat(i) Ko Sar Maddh Khirikaveeaa Dhur Taaee||249||
translation: They are standing in a queue in this way as if the blossoming lotus-buds are standing in the tank and viewing the moon.249.
